data.title: Stuffed Pork Chop
data.text: If you want to bring someone from out of state to a good Cajun cooked rice and gravy, have them try a Stuffed Pork Chop plate at Antlers Downtown. They will thank you forever. It come with a HUGE Stuffed Pork Chop with the best stuffing ever. Also a salad to start or cup of gumbo if you choose. It also come loaded with Field Peas and a Yam pattie. You will leave full to the top and not disappointed I promise.

data.title: Great rice & gravy
data.text: Go on Wednesday and get the smothered pork chop and rice and gravy. One of the best meals at any restaurant in Lafayette - and that's saying a lot.

data.title: The best little home cooking Restuarant around.
data.text: If you are in the downtown town area of Lafayette, you must check out this Restuarant.  Best southern style meals like we cook at home.  There is something on the menu to please everyone. The price is low to medium range.the food is like Sunday lunch at Grandmas

data.title: Great Home Cooking
data.text: This restaurant  has been around for many years.  The food is nothing fancy just good consistent quality home style cajun food.   Location is downtown and there is easy parking nearby.  So if you are visiting downtown Lafayette .....give it a try.

data.title: Almost Too Hot To Eat
data.text: Went for Monday's smothered round steak with rice, smothered potatoes, and green beans.  For years Antlers has cooked just on the edge of being too hot.  You have to wash it down with lots of water or whatever you are drinking.  The potatoes could be substituted by another vegetable and the green beans are good. If they would just lay off the red pepper a bit it would be a lot more enjoyable.  And yet I still go....

data.title: a good day to eat out
data.text: The food at Antlers is very delicious.  Just like mother's cooking.  Cannot select a special dish because everything is worth sampling.

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text: There isn't much to it on the outside, but the staff is super friendly, and the food is excellent. Try whatever the special of the day is. It's always great.

data.title: Dark, dreary and nothing to write home about
data.text: Wow. What a disappointment. I had heard really good things about the food here and it was not appealing at all. Dear, dreary and smells like a nasty bar. Honestly couldn't wait to be furnished. I think it's more of a lunch hangout for men and I don't mind hole-in-the-wall places if the food is good but I would definitely give this one a miss. Downtown Lafayette is full of great eateries--don't waste your time with this one.

data.title: Men's fellowship  Lunch
data.text: We went for our weekly lunch at 11 am .The lunch special was more food than I could eat so I ordered the soft shell crab.It was o k but had more batter than I like.

data.title: Great Cajun Food!
data.text: delecious authentic cajun food, Gumbo, etouffe, rice and gravy. great place to be for Festival International during April, they have live music every night during festival. They also have live music during downtown alive on friday nights, however, that is seasonal, only during Spring and Fall., and only the bar is open on those nights.

data.title: Fun and laidback atmosphere!
data.text: Antler's lunches are usually pretty amazing! They have a great night life. It is a great place to catch a band.

data.title: Wonderful food and portions
data.text: I have never been disappointed with Antlers.  The food is excellent and the portions plentiful for the money.

data.title: Excellent & Friendly
data.text: I ate there for lunch and try to make it at least twice a month. It is better to go First thing or Last thing during lunch cuz the parking is difficult. No matter though, the food is awesome and the desserts are even better....I always dine alone; but, the other day, I watched this party of 12. They all ordered a different plate. I watched as the waitress made their salads with dressing and PLACED them exactly in the correct order WITHOUT asking the customers. Then within 10 minutes, the plates were all brought out and let me just say, that I was TOTALLY impressed with the variety and the hotness of each plate--STRAIGHT out of the Pan. They all looked great. I just cannot say enough GOOD about this restaurant. When I eat, I am never Bothered and I never have to ask for Anything. When my tea nears empty, here comes the server. I hate for my glass to get refilled BEFORE it is empty for TWO reasons: I cannot tell how much I have drank for calorie purposes and I drink tea so it messes me up on the sweet and low to get it to the right taste. Regardless, Antler's get its right EVERY time.

data.title: Absolute best plate lunch
data.text: It's only available Monday - Friday for lunch - but it's the best plate lunch in town.  Items off the menu are good but go for the special of the day especially if it is smothered and stuffed!

data.title: Oh My God!  Love the Stuffed Pork Chops!
data.text: Oh My God!  Love the Stuffed Pork Chops!  First I have only eaten at Antlers for lunch.  They have a full menu, and usually three or four daily specials.  But back to the Stuffed Pork Chops, they are literally an inch and a half to two inches thick.  The first time I was there I was like where's the steak knife to cut this thing as all they give you is a butter knife.  Good news is you don't even need the butter knife.  This thing breaks apart with a fork.  You are going to want to go in the back and see if your grandmother is back there cooking.  The pork chop is served with rice and gravy and a couple of other sides which they could leave off, because if you can just finish the pork chop and the rice and gravy you will be stuffed!!!

data.title: Don't believe the 5-star reviews
data.text:
Our first meal there was mediocre. Our second was terrible, even by Broussard/Youngsville standards. It was not worth the money you will spend. 

I ordered the crawfish etoufee, he ordered the eggplant Louisiane. I knew we were in trouble when our entrees came out less than 10 minutes after we ordered. (Pre-cooked, reheated.) My etoufee was lukewarm (at best) with Uncle Ben's minute rice plunked in the center and less than 10 crawfish in the sauce itself (I counted, it was all I ate). That wasn't even the bad part - it was sweet, like high fructose corn syrup sweet. Really awful and completely not worth the $21 charge. I ordered the brussel sprouts as a side (with an up-charge over the potato salad) and they were so oily, if I'd had a paper napkin, I would have attempted to soak up some of before I ate them. Overly salted, very little flavor, clearly cooked earlier, then reheated. 

His eggplant Louisiane is a typical dish around here, done so much better at other restaurants. Ironically, it was all salt with very little sweet; some sherry would have improved it, albeit marginally. 

We closed out the evening with all our entrees 25% consumed. I thought maybe, well, we came to a "steakhouse" and didn't order steak, but we ran into some friends on our way out, who sent their steaks back twice and also didn't finish most of their food. Such a shame. 

The worst part is that we really want more restaurants on the Broussard end of Youngsville (or the Youngsville end of Broussard) to succeed. HookedUp is a total disaster, Romacelli's is a joke; there just seems to be a curse on restaurants that open up here. Notwithstanding, Antlers didn't even seem to be trying. An utter waste of time and money.

owner_response.author: Jdwalt1969, Owner at Antlers, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Sorry for your bad experience.  Our mission at Antlers is to continue to produce the best possible products using the freshest ingredients.  We continue to make everything from scratch using our proven recipes that have been tested for over 30 years and produce fresh new ideas that fit our Cajun Heritage.  Not only do we have a passion for food but a passion for service.  We work very hard at producing the best product and service for the residents of Broussard.  Hope you give us a try again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great service, atmosphere & food too!
data.text: Our server was great!  We had the salmon & gumbo.  It was very good.  We will definitely be going back!

data.title: NEW Antlers
data.text: new antlers  in broussard next to le triomphe....food excellent, our group had salads, fried shrimp, gumbo, steaks...so it was well rounded, and the food was good and the view of the golf course very relaxing

data.title: Great dinner dining experience.
data.text: My wife went there recently for dinner. I must say the food was excellent, and the service was great.

data.title: Old fashioned place but food nothing special
data.text:
The place is old (1920's) and they have maintained the decor in a way that brings you back in time. The restaurant is pretty big but was almost empty for lunch. And be advised that they have no baby changer. 

The server was well intentioned, but not very familiar with the menu items, and could really not tell us what anything was. Hmm...

The food itself was about average. Well, the Étouffée on rice was spicy and excellent, but the catfish julienne with crawfish could have been better and so the smothered chicken. All the food seemed homemade but the taste did simply not live up to the expectations.

Price reasonable but to cheap. Lunch for 2 about $50.
